heading: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit.
content:
In the example above, the : :-webkit-scrollbar-track selector targets the background of the scrollbar track, while the : :-webkit-scrollbar-thumb selector targets the scrollbar thumb. The : :-webkit-scrollbar-thumb:hover selector targets the scrollbar thumb when it is hovered over with the mouse.

You can adjust the background color, border radius, width, and other properties of the scrollbar track and thumb to suit your needs. Additionally, you can use other pseudo-element selectors, such as : :-webkit-scrollbar-corner and : :-webkit-scrollbar-button, to target other components of the scrollbar UI.

It's worth noting that this CSS only applies to webkit-based browsers such as Google Chrome, Safari, and Opera. For Firefox, you can use : :-moz-scrollbar pseudo-elements.
